title: COVID-19
description: Information on LCHC's response to coronavirus (COVID-19).
cleaned_text: We are administering the initial series and booster doses of the Moderna and Pfizer vaccines. We are able to vaccinate children 12+ and adults. Please call for an appointment. Lakeshore Community Health Care does not have the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for children 5 - 11 years old. To find a provider offering the vaccine visit [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/search/) We continue to offer COVID-19 testing and care for our patients and community members without a regular doctor who have symptoms or who have been in contact with someone who tested positive for Coronavirus. Symptoms can include fever, cough, shortness of breath, sore throat, headache, fatigue, body or muscle aches, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or loss of smell or taste. Call 920-686-2333 (Manitowoc) or 920-783-6633 (Sheboygan) to determine if there is a need for a testing. To limit exposure to the staff and other patients, it is very important to call before coming to the clinic. per year One Page Website Responsive Website Logo Design Professional, Custom Design per year One Page Website Responsive Website Logo Design Professional, Custom Design per year One Page Website Responsive Website Logo Design Professional, Custom Design The virus causing coronavirus disease (COVID-19), is not the same as the [coronaviruses that commonly circulate among humans](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/types.html) and cause mild illness, like the common cold. The virus that causes COVID-19 seems to be spreading easily and sustainably in the community in [some affected geographic areas](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prepare/transmission.html). This is a rapidly evolving situation and the [risk assessment](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/cases-updates/summary.html#risk-assessment) may change daily. The latest updates are available on CDC's Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) website. Reported symptoms have ranged from mild to severe illness for confirmed coronavirus (COVID-19) cases.The following symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure. - Fever - Cough - Shortness of breath, difficulty breathing - Sore throat - Loss of taste or smell - Headaches - Body or muscle aches - Abdominal discomfort, diarrhea - Vomiting Call your doctor: If you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 and develop a fever and symptoms call your healthcare provider. Implement [steps to prevent illness](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prepare/prevention.html) (e.g., stay home when sick, hand washing, cover coughs and sneezes, clean frequently touched surfaces daily, wear a face mask if you are sick). Testing requires authorization. Please do not show up at emergency rooms (unless you are critically ill) or LCHC's clinic. If you are a patient at LCHC [contact us](/contact) or based on your insurance call or visit one of the following: Prevea Health - Utilize Prevea Virtual Care's free [COVID-19 assessment](http://prevea.com/virtualcare) to determine if you need to be tested for COVID-19. Advocate Aurora Health - Call 866-443-2584 if you think you've been exposed to COVID-19, are experiencing symptoms or need to learn more about testing. Holy Family Memorial - Call 920-320-3333. Please do not let cost keep you from talking with us if you have COVID-19 symptoms. All insurance copays are currently waived for medically necessary screening and testing for Coronavirus Disease. Additionally, we have support for patients without insurance. It is understandable and expected that people will experience worry and stress during this time. And, for individuals living with mental health conditions, it is important to know when these natural emotions are becoming anxiety.
